title: App isn't installed but it did.

thread.text: I'm using Honor 7x and currently installing several apps such as WhatsApp and Wattpad. It did appear on my homescreen and went well at first but then, when I wanted to click on the icon again, it showed "App Isn't Installed". I'd tried to update the app and reboot my device. Well it worked but then it happened again after that. Anyone knows how to fix this? And why does it happen?

title: Huawei Honor 7x Damage

thread.text:
I received my Huawei Honor 7x on a Friday. I put a screen protector and phone case on it the same day. As soon as I turned it on I noticed problems. The screen wasn't responsive at times, especially at the bottom of the screen. I thought, well maybe I can deal with it but the problem worsened. On Monday I called their (crappy) customer service to arrange for phone repair and went back to using my old but dependable HTC. Three days and two more phone calls later they finally sent me a shipping label. 
Yesterday I got my Honor phone back. A note said they wouldn't repair it because of liquid damage, which also voided the warranty. The phone has had a screen protector and phone case the entire time I've had it, it's never been near water, but the problems started as soon as I used it.
I'm furious, obviously called them, but there's nothing they will do. The phone evidently was damaged before they even sent it to me and now I've been ripped off. 
Meanwhile, the problems are worse. The phone will not play sound now. I'm furious. 
Is there anything I can do to fix it, or is there anyway to get Huawei to replace it?

Welcome to Android Central! I moved this from the Honor 7 forum to the Honor 7X forum, just to be specific.
Probably the only thing you can do is be persistent, and keep calling. Ask for things to be escalated to the next customer service level. Be firm but polite -- don't sound like you're losing your temper, because that will just make them less willing to help. It would have been ideal to take a video of the phone in action as soon as you saw the issue, because the timestamp of the video might have helped show them that you didn't have the phone for very long before the problem started (just something to remember in the future). The problem is that there's no definitive way to prove that the phone wasn't exposed to water while in your possession, so it's essentially your word against theirs.
When you talk to a higher level of customer service, try buttering them up and talk about how excited you were to get your 7X, and how you were hoping to continue using Honor products in the future. Ask them if there's anything they can do to help you remain a Huawei/Honor customer. Good luck!

title: Honor 7 How to disable mobile data package and re-enable mobile data?

thread.text: I'm currently vacationing in the UK (I'm from Finland) and I was using roaming data whenever I was out of Wifi range. I figured I'd put in a limit so my bill wouldn't be astronomical so I used the mobile data settings to put in 1GB. Since the phone calculates used data per month instead of when the package was put in I quickly got to the max and my phone cut off mobile data altogether. Now even when I turn it on it won't connect. I've tried rebooting, setting the limit higher, changing the setting to notify me after the package is exceeded and resetting the network settings. Nothing works, it just won't connect! There seems to be no way to turn off the package (except resetting the network settings and that didn't help). Please help me fix this soon, it's ruining my Christmas.
Just unchecking the "Set mobile data limit" box should re-enable mobile data.

replies.text:
Unfortunately there is no box to check or uncheck... After the limit has been set I can only alter the limit, I can't even set it at zero. There wasn't a box to check to start with and there isn't one after it has been set.
I ended up restoring factory settings to fix this and even that didn't help.

thread.text: Also, you should shut off background data on all apps that you don't need to sync, to help reduce your data usage.

Update: I'm getting a feeling this isn't about the data limit at all. Today I tried texting and calling and neither worked! I have sufficient reception (3-4 bars) and my phone says there is none. For my operator, 60 euros per month is the automatic limit for roaming buildup and once you've got the limit they send you a text. I've used data for less than 2 euros and haven't made any calls or sent any texts. I'm taking my phone in for service once I get home, but this really ruined my holiday.

title: Can you disable the "do not cover the top of your phone" msg?

thread.text: My son has an Honor 7 and wants to wear it in a plastic/elastic armband when he goes for a jog. But when he puts the phone in the plastic case, he gets the message "do not cover the top of the screen - Make sure the screen is clean - You can also press the power and volume buttons to disable this mode". But this does not help. Any suggestions?

replies.text: I'm very interested knowing that too.
just disable Settings -> Accessibility - Palm rejection - turn off

thread.text: Yeah, have same problem. I just turn off blocking but still when I want to change something on phone then I need to fold back top of armband. I think it's impossible to change that without root. Or he can use transparent armband.

So would I.
It's a really really really annoying feature that some muppet of a developer decided to design in.
I have a transparent armband, and a transparent bike case, and it still does it.
It's also a pain with the buttons on my P8 to disable it EVERY ********** time GRRRR! :-

Go into Settings, click Smart assistance and inactivate Touch-disable mode
Posted via the Android Central App

The feature is supposed to be for when you have it in your pocket or in a bag so that you don't butt dial somebody or so it doesn't change your settings or call somebody or charge your account that's what it's for and you can disable that is called touch in your settings so that "Muppet" of a developer actually cure the but the problem other than having a phone lock on or a password cuz a lot of people don't do that we ain't got nothing to hide we put the locks on our PayPal XD you would have been thanking that "muppet" like 10 years ago

I tried the "settings" and click smart assist- but I do not have a smart assist option in my settings.. 
Is their any other way I can do this?
"Smart assist" is just the title of that group of settings selections (on my phone at least). For me the switch to turn it off is the "More..." selection under the smart assist heading.
Simultaneously hold the power, and the volume up buttons a few times to disable! :-)

Yeah, I'm having this issue too. It wasn't a big deal before but now, it started doing it when its in my bike's phone mount.
My phone mount doesn't even cover much of the top. Just the corners of the phone. I kinda need out to map check for my courier work.

replies.text:
do as me
pray for me ^_^

thread.text: I think I just found it. I'm using a huawei y3ii and under accessibility, I found anti-inadvertently function. Turned it off and now I'm free again.
Smart assistance>> More >> Touch-disable mode

If you have a Huawei Y6 Elite and want to turn off the touch-disable mode.... Go to Settings < Smart Assistance < More < turn off touch-disabled mode. Once you have done this restart your phone or it won't disable. :-)

replies.text:
I have the same issue. I don't know why the phone entered the Touch Mode and now even if I restart it or pus simultaneous the volume and power button still remains in that mood.
Thanks!

title: Can I root LEM-21 without data loss using kingroot desktop app?

thread.text: So I wanted to root my Huawei Honor 7 Lite, but the problem was that kingroot android app just wint do it, there's no get root button, so I wanted to know, will using the desktop kingroot app wil try to unlock my phone's bootloader, because I read somewhere that if I try to unlock the bootloader, it would wipe my phone's data, but I dont really want to loose it, also I used kingroot app on 2 diffirent phones before, and it worked perfectly.
I've never had to use kingroot, but if the desktop program has to unlock the bootloader, then yes, it will wipe the device.
Well it would be nice to know if it unlocks the bootloader. EDIT: I just realized that there is KingRoot and kingoroot diffirent apps.
So I tried using KingoRoot to root my phone, and it failed, I also tried using the android root app, it failed too. What do I do to make it root?
Magisk is much much better than kingoroot.

I need a way of not unlocking bootloader and flashing custom recoveries. Also magisk wont help because it needs a phone with root, or a custom recovery, which i dont have any of these, also, here's a tip, read everything, because you missed a lot of details here, did you even read the title of this question?

replies.text:
Mod note: there is no need to be rude. It's easy to overlook part of a post.
If you need a custom recovery installed, there is no way of getting around unlocking the bootloader. At least not that I am aware of.

thread.text: Personally, I dont feel that I need a custom recovery installed, because I dont plan on doing any stuff like flashing other systems and such, I just need to root my phone. I tried using Framaroot but it did not find any exploits on my phone.

replies.text: The custom recovery is most likely needed to flash the superuser file.

thread.text: Oh well, that will means I wont root my phone.
What do you need root access for?

It's going to be very difficult to root a modern phone without an unlocked bootloader and customer recovery due to several changes Google has made to Android starting with version 5. Specifically one of the big changes is that to make the necessary modifications to the system image to have the thing boot, you need a modified boot image... that isn't something you'll do with an app.
If you can load an app and clicky click unlock and root it... a malicious app can do the same thing without you having any idea.
If only data loss wouldnt be a problem when unlocking bootloader, i might do it.

2. Have a French number and a cheap contract or pay as you go sim.
Is this even possible?!
Thank you so much for any help on this. I have until this Saturday to get it together.

title: Why won't Huawei Honor 7 Lite be recognized by my computer?

thread.text: So I have Huawei Honor 7 Lite phone, and I wanted to move some files from the phone to the PC, but I couldn't do that. All the time it's just recognizing My CD Drive with Huawei HiSuite installer on it. I tried installing Huawei HiSuite, but it still didn't work, neither the phone got recognized by it. I've tried many times switching HDB and ADB on and off, and only one time it worked, but the files i needed weren't there. I am running windows 10 64bit, the phone is running Android 7.0 Nougat. Oh and also, why can't I access the cat collection minigame on the phone, on my old phone with custom firmware it worked.

When you connect via USB, swipe the notification panel down and tap the USB icon -- make sure it's set to MTP.
The Android easter eggs don't always show up -- it depends on the manufacturer. Huawei presumably removed it in their build.

title: How to hide videos

thread.text: I downloaed some video s of actress how to hide from gallery

Download a file manager app from the Play Store and use it to create a new, separate folder for videos, and any other multimedia files you don't want to indexed and cataloged by apps like the Gallery app. Create a new file in this new folder and name it '.nomedia' (no quotes) The file type isn't an issue, it's the file name in this situation that's the key. Anyway, any media apps that auto-scan folders for media content will skip any folder with a .nomedia file in it.
As for a good file manager, if you're rooted I recommend Root Explorer. If not,. take a look at Solid Explorer or File Expert.

title: Cannot connect to Google servers error after factory reset

thread.text:
Hi all, I thought this could be useful for those who like me have looked for a solution to this problem.
Three days ago I had to carry out a factory reset on my Honor 7 (PLK-1) Android 6.0 smarphone. The result of it was that I couldn't sign into my Google account anymore. The message I was getting after typing in my credentials and agreeing to Google's policies was "Cannot connect to Google servers. Please try later." My smarphone was unable to comunicate with google. A true nightmare, as you may imagine. Unfortunately, nothing of what I found on the net was applicable to my phone.
However, I won't be annoying you with what troubleshooting steps did not  work. I'd like to share WHAT WORKED in my case.
From Settings-Apps I opened one by one the
*Google app (Launcher)
*Gmail app
*Google Play services app
*Google Play store app
and 
1. Cleared the cache
2.Under "Manage space" hit "Clear Google Search data" and "Clear all data"
Turned the phone off and on (not "restart")
and marvelously everything started running as it should! 
I was finaly able to sign into my Google account, Sync my Gmail, Calendar, Maps, Apps ect. 
I hope this article will help you out. If it does, please let me know. Or if you have had any other solution, please add it here.
Cheers and good luck!
Welcome to Android Central, and thanks for the tip!

Great post!
But, what if this message comes before you install the phone?
In other words: I gave my phone a factory reset, when it boots the first time, I have to choose a language, then connect to WiFi and after that it'll check my internet connection. It then says 'Cannot connect or communicate with Google servers' and offers me to try again later. It doesn't let me proceed to boot the phone, which is quite annoying as I can't use my phone now.
Any ideas?
Found a solution: take out the simcard, reboot and try again.

title: Allocating SMS alerts (not ringtones) for contacts with Emotion UI...?

thread.text:
Hi guys.
I want to allocate SMS alerts tones (not ringtones) to specific contacts with my Honor 7: can I do this?
Samsung’s TouchWiz, has an option to add a message alert to contacts, i.e. “Add another field >message alert”. However, Emotion has no such option. Those available with EMUI are portrayed in the screenshots, where it can be seen no facility to add a specific message alert to a contact exists. 
If this can't be done via the OS can anyone recomend an app (other than Ringo which doesn't work) which can allow specific alerts/message tones to be allocated to individual contacts?
Thanks in advance for any help. 
Honor 7
Android 6.0
Emotion 4.0.1Attachment 248314Attachment 248315

Hi, there! Unfortunately, I do not think these options are available via Emotion's UI. How do you feel about changing your stock messaging app? I feel like Textra had a setting in which you could apply different notification tones to different contacts, and you could also reset the process on all contacts if you wish to start over. Good luck!

title: My running app randomly stops working on Honor 7

thread.text:
I bought an Honor 7 back in July, and ever since then my running apps randomly stop working. It almost never works for longer than a couple of hours or so (my last three sessions cut out after 63, 102 & 89 mins), and then it just stops without any warning. 
I'm not sure what the phone was delivered with, but it has now updated itself to Android 6.0. It didn't work before the update and it doesn't work now. I'm 99% sure that this isn't an issue where it can't find a GPS, as my previous phone had no problems and I haven't changed my routes. The GPS always seems to be picking up strong signals.
It has been suggested on other sites that it might be the power manager turning my app off, but the running apps I use are protected. I can't see a way of turning off the power manager to test that theory out.
Does anyone have any suggestions? Other than ditch the phone and go back to my old one.
Welcome to Android Central! Which apps are doing this? Are they running in the foreground or background?

Hi! I use Runkeeper mainly, but I've tried it with Google Fit too and it still failed after about 70/90 mins. I've tried it running in the foreground and the background, but it doesn't make a difference. I'm really just looking for any ideas to try, which will be gratefully received.
Any other 3rd party battery-saver apps installed? Or a carrier-branded app that either the carrier installed or you installed?

title: Apps "reset" after a while

thread.text: Say I'm browsing imgur or some other website and I'm at a certain point, a specific image or place in a text/article. If I minimize the app or open another app, after a couple of minutes or when I turn my screen off and on again, the website or imgur or whatever will have "reset", meaning it's back to the front page and not at the picture I was looking at last, or top of the article I was reading instead of the middle of the page where I left off. Does anyone have any idea why this happens and if it's possible to turn off? Thanks.

Welcome to Android Central! It might have to do with Huawei's aggressive RAM management. Look in Settings>Advanced Settings>Battery Manager>Protected Apps, and make sure the browser is Protected. If it isn't, then it's prone to being closed quickly by the system in order to "clean RAM" (the utility of which I always question, because this isn't how Android was designed).

title: HELP!!! - Phone reset whilst updating - HELP!!!

thread.text:
Hi,
My phone is the Honor 7, previously running EMUI 3.1, now running a dodgy EMUI 4.
The back story; (For additional information)
I wanted to get the new EMUI 4 update on my phone, but needed to update to B180 from B121. This update would constantly fail at 10%. I figured this was due to the 'root' I had on my device. However, this was a partial-root as some things would work and some things wouldn't. I originally rooted my phone with KingRoot. I could not un-root my device with superuser, SuperSU or KingRoot. I tried to install a custom recovery but that failed. I came across a thread with OTA updates and new 'stock' ROMs for EMUI 3.1 and EMUI 4 for my device specifically (PLK-L01). I downloaded this and followed the instructions in the provided pdf. I navigated my phone on windows and copied the entire internal storage to a folder named 'Backup'.I also used  to make a copy of 'all' my phones files - once the command ran it spent 5 minutes skipping 'special files'. I took out my SD card and backed this up too, in a folder called 'SD_Backup'. I formatted my SD card ready for the update file.
I placed the update.app into the /dload folder on my SD card and typed  and selected Software Upgrade, SDCard Upgrade, OK. The phone promptly rebooted and booted into the update screen. The update went swimmingly until 100% where it flashed Done, then Software Install Failed. The phone automatically rebooted and I was greeted with a setup screen, asking for my prefered language. I figured it had worked, but then to my horror none of my apps were there and all my files had been wiped. I was distraught and still am.
I after checking the backups after the reset I have found that most, if not all the folders were empty from my 'Internal Storage' backup. I am not too bothered about losing my apps as most of these are cloud apps, however I am most worried about my contacts and messages. I am not installing any apps as of yet, in my knowledge the files haven't been overwritten yet so technically they're still recoverable? I had a lot of contacts that took time to get and knowing my status, it will be difficult to get them back. Additionally, some apps, like the camera, have updated to bring a whole host of new features to the Honor 7, however the music app has not, I do not have 'Screen Candy' or 'Protective Eye Mode' which are shown on the offical EMUI 4 features website here
So the questions;
How to recover my contacts and/or messages? (Google, helpful as always, did NOT backup my contacts or messages)
How to recover apps that were 'installed on SD card'? (As all SD card data is, hopefully, intact)
How to update settings and other appropiate apps?
WHY THE FLIPPING HELL DID THE UPDATE WIPE MY PHONE?!
Is there any way to recover anything at all? 
Thanks so much for reading all of that,
Jake

replies.text:

Not sure if the update in India was kind of a soak test, as the listing for the phone shows as Upgradeable to MM in Feb:Honor 7 is getting Android 6.0 Marshmallow update in India | Android Central

thread.text: Well, looks like there aren't many AC readers using Honor 7. Or they haven't downloaded the beta MM update.

I picked the phone up yesterday, for that exact reason - I was interested to try a Chinese phone, so far I love it - it's a bit different coming from stock Android, but it's a welcome change. My past few phones have been the Nexus 6, Nexus 5x and Moto X Style so going to something totally different is refreshing. 
I'll give it a couple of days and report back on performance etc.

So far, the 7 seems good- great screen and battery life, good performance, decent cameras. Will have to play more with some EMUI themes now 
My phone should get MM in the next week. It has already started rolling out in India. Will post a review once I get it.

thread.text:
Had my honor 7 for a little over a week and all is very well indeed. Good battery life ans for coming from always had a 5.5 screen is still plenty big enough at 5.2 for videos , etc. It's always responsive and the MIUI needs a bit of getting used to, but so what once you know your way around ir does the job perfectly well. The fast charge is just that, very fast in a few mins you get 30/40% charge if not more (depends what you do or don't have running). Huawei just needs to come good with their promise of MM in March, bring it on!

title: Honor 7 notifications

thread.text:
So I just upgraded to this phone and all is well, love it! But, I'm having major issues with notifications. Facebook, Messenger and Whatsapp all have issues. Messenger works, sometimes and Facebook and Whatsapp just don't work. Checking the apps in power saving I've made sure they're protected to not turn off, notification manager I've checked to make sure notifications are on and also do not disturb isn't on. In App manager I've made sure notifications are set to on also and on the apps themselves I've checked to make sure notifications are on so I think I've covered all bases but nope, nothing.
Posted via the Android Central App

The only way to check I've had a reply is to physically open the app which is so poor. Surely this isn't right.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Suddenly any media play slightly faster?

thread.text:
Hello, since yesterday my Honor 7 started to play music, videos, and also streaming videos/music slighlty faster than normal, let's say it is x1.2.
I can notice this also looking at the timing bar in player, seconds flow faster than real seconds.
Last days I was playing a bit with Tasker doing some batches for GPS and location, but i think this cant be the cause. Would be nonsense.
I searched a lot around the web and found lot of people having this kind of problem, but not exactly this one, they found their device playing a lot faster (i.e. 2x, 3x, chipmunkie style). So i couldn't find any solution for now.
I am on LLP 5.0.1, unlocked, twrp, rooted.
Any help is really appreciated!
Thanks!

Did you find any solution to your issue? I haven't noticed this, but I've only had it 12 hours  does the issue happen with the stock video and music player on the phone or does it happen with any media content regardless of the playback software?

replies.text: Dunno everything is magically back to normal

thread.text:
Brilliant :-)

title: What does Octa core mean?

thread.text: Ok so I am so new to phones. I am getting the Huawei Honor 7 and I want to know what Octa Core means? Please don't be mean......

It just means that processor (phones "brain") have eight cores so it can make 8 tasks simultaneously. In another words - it's faster and you can turn on more apps on it without noticing much efficiency loss.

Taken from Google - The terms octa-core and quad-core denote the number of processor cores in a CPU. Octa is eight, quad is four. So far, so obvious. But the key difference between the two – at least when talking about mobile chips in 2015 – is how these processor cores are set up.

title: How can I get my contacts onto it?

thread.text: How can I get my contacts onto my Huawei Honor 7? I have a flip phone and no Google Contacts. Will I have to type them in one at a time or can transfer them over Bluetooth?

I depends how old flip phone you have. You can use contacts app from google store to import them to PC and then to Honor OR hope that they will be imported from sim card. Again - it depends on what flip phone do you have.

title: Honor 7 - Is Emotion UI a let down

thread.text: i am really impressed with the specs and display of honor 7 and planning to consider it over oneplus 2. However i am seeing online that the EMUI is a let down . I have never used an android before and i dont want my first time experience to be let down by a below par android customized os. Please suggest me if Honor 7 software would be good enough or should i think of oneplus 2 ?

Welcome to Android Central! I don't have a phone with EMUI, but from my understanding, part of the dissatisfaction is with how they try to make it work like iOS. There's less ability to customize your homescreen (for example, I think all app shortcut icons must appear on the homescreen, as opposed to having a separate App Drawer).
But you can easily get past this by installing an alternate launcher like Google Now Launcher or Nova Launcher.

Tbh - I love it. And I've never been apple fan. Everything looks clear, is easy to find and manage. I've had some problems with making new folders, but fast google fixed it (you have to just pull one icon on another). I can recommend it, it's really advantage not disadvantage.

title: My Huawei Honor Holly phone has a white screen and it turns off automatically, how can I get the pics off of the phone?

thread.text: when i was using my phone it stucked and the screen was running fast.after few seconds it turned off.then i again switched it on.again the same thing happened and now i can't switch it on.it displays only a white screen when i try turning on it.i want to get the pics saved to phone memory.i tried to connect it to my pc.but a message popped out saying that the device is not working.is there any way to get those pics?please help me.

The challenge is if you can't get the phone into any type of bootable or recovery mode it will be a challenge to get the data back. Here are a couple threads on similar challenges in recovering data on a dead phone.http://forums.androidcentral.com/t-g...ead-phone.htmlhttp://forums.androidcentral.com/htc...ck-5-days.html

title: Does it have Google Play installed already?

thread.text: Does the Huawei Honor 7 have Google Play services installed already? If not, is this something that is easy to install?
Yes, Google Play Store comes preinstalled.
How is the camera quality compared to the huawei p8 specially at low light conditions?

The P8 camera is better at low light conditions than the H7 camera since the P8 camera has OIS. The H7 camera is better at normal to good light conditions as detail is a lot better due to higher resolution. I use both of the two phones but prefer the H7 now due to better detail.
